TopicTitle: Creepy disassembly or just another Kraken?

Articles.Content:
After a test of new rocket and just before the end of today's gameplay, I went to tracking station to check the probe I sent to the outer space of Kerbol system. The sun looked small, the solar panels doiing nothing with 1.00 explosure, sensors giving out data, well, everything seemed just fine.

Then I saw a small white circle floating somewhere near my probe.

My antenna? What on earth just happened?!

There was no crash or any boooom happened. Everythings looks normal except antenna floating around sliently.

Weird...

Then another thing happened. My gravity sensor thought he should have a vacation alone, well, after a long long working year and it just left the spacecraft.

I sent probe to deep space before but I never found this kind of thing. Is it just another Kraken? Environmental friendly Kraken?

Deep Space Disassebley Syndrome (DSDS or DS2)

Never seen something like that.

I've also had some instances of spontaneous disassembly in interplanetary space.

I had to reload a few times in the last version to get a manned Eeloo mission to complete a transfer burn without fuel tanks inexplicably shearing off.

Edited October 27, 2013 by Maddmatts

Deep Space Kraken is immortal, and will be banished to the realms of physics optimisation forever in the final battle of KSP Release Candidates.

These things happen, it's an alpha.
I've had things disassemble before, but not one piece at a time, when it's happened to my things it's always been sudden and catastrophic.
